result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mollie D Chavez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mollie D Chavez in court with attorney Paul J Hammes.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Victim notification compliance.  Plea questionnaire filed.
State's offer and recommendation:  Pl to cts 2,3 in 12CF; 14CF dismiss/read-in.  Imposed/stayed time, stand silent on amount; 2 yrs probation.  If revoked, counts to be run consecutive.  Take meds as ordered.  Counseling, etc,; employment; no alcohol, controlled substances, RUAs, 90 days RCJ stayed. 
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of crime and possible penalties.
State consents to jury waiver.
PLEA - no contest
10CF777 - convicted of 2 misd counts.  Defendant stipulates to prior.  10CM1345 convicted of DC.  Defendant stipulates.   Priors as basis for repeater modifier.
Finding of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. 
Sentencing argument.
BTC: Ct 2:  1 yr RCJ
           Ct 3:  1 yr RCJ     impose/stay both; but if revoked, to be served consecutively
           2 yrs probation
continue to take medications as prescribed by any health care provider.  Follow up and maintain visits.  Engage in counseling appropriate.
Continue to seek and maintain full time gainful employment if able
no alcohol, controlled substances, except Rx, AODA, RUAs
90 days ea count concurrent, stayed as long as compliant with terms and conditions of probation
court costs
DNA surcharge
CFTS

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    ***TO BE CO-SIGNED BY: MEDIA MORONES D.O.B.- 1/28/1971***  Defendant is to live with mother and mother is to oversee defendant's medical issues and care.  Defendant is to follow mother's house rules.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11-26-2014:  Defendant must contact Attorney Hammes every Tuesday.**

Defendant Mollie D Chavez in court with attorney Paul J Hammes.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Matter was set for PLEAS.
Defense req adj - Atty Hammes hasn't had a chance to meet with client.
BTC:  Bond mod to include that def is to contact Atty Hammes once a week on Tues.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
